programme.title: The Pharaohs: Greater Than The Pyramids
programme.sub-title: A pharaoh of the 20th dynasty, Ramses IIIs reign was marked by internal conspiracies and a tragic end that symbolised the end of the golden age of Pharaonic Egypt.
programme.desc: Djoser, Khufu, Ramses II, Ramses III, Alexander the Great and Cleopatra - this series explores the life and reign of these pharaohs while illuminating their relationship with other Pharaonic figures.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: Queens of Ancient Egypt
programme.sub-title: The Egyptian queen Tiye inspired a religious revolution over 3,000 years ago that threw Egypt into turmoil - and may have blazed a trail for the worlds leading religions.
programme.desc: The famous Cleopatra is only one in a long line of Egyptian queens spanning 3,000 years of history; we explore the lives of three of ancient Egypts fascinating and charismatic female monarchs.

programme.title: Queens of Ancient Egypt
programme.sub-title: Cleopatra II, namesake of the great Cleopatra VII, had an even more shocking reign; she saw her dynasty torn apart by hatred but also saved it from destruction.
programme.desc: The famous Cleopatra is only one in a long line of Egyptian queens spanning 3,000 years of history; we explore the lives of three of ancient Egypts fascinating and charismatic female monarchs.

programme.title: Queens of Ancient Egypt
programme.sub-title: Cleopatra Selene, daughter of Cleopatra the Great and Mark Antony, was taken to Rome as a prisoner; she eventually married the African king Juba II and became one of that continents greatest queens.
programme.desc: The famous Cleopatra is only one in a long line of Egyptian queens spanning 3,000 years of history; we explore the lives of three of ancient Egypts fascinating and charismatic female monarchs.

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: The first empress of Rome, the ruthless Livia Drusilla, carved a corpse-strewn path to putting her own son on the emperors throne before her golden dynasty descended into an age of terror.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: Livia, the first empress of Rome, came to regret the scheming that put her son Tiberius on the throne as he and his heir Caligula dragged the empire into an age of tyranny and shocking depravity.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: Claudius rose to the throne but was poisoned by his wife; after his successor Nero alienated Rome, Livia Drusillas dynasty ended with brutal power struggles but having changed the course of history.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.sub-title: Julius Caesar wanted to bring all of Gaul under his control, triggering a series of events that would bring his army to the brink of defeat - now archaeologists are uncovering what really happened.
programme.desc: Almost all evidence about the Gallic Wars came from an account written by the general himself; now historians and archaeologists are hunting for the truth about Caesars barbarian conquest.

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.sub-title: We explore the events triggered by the uniting of Gaul tribes under freedom fighter Vercingetorix, and archaeologists find evidence of the defences that the Gauls built to fight off Caesars legions.
programme.desc: Almost all evidence about the Gallic Wars came from an account written by the general himself; now historians and archaeologists are hunting for the truth about Caesars barbarian conquest.

programme.title: Out of Europe
programme.desc: For decades most experts have been convinced that Africa is the cradle of mankind, but researchers have come across more finds in recent years that cast doubt on this well-established theory.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.sub-title: The Vikings from Scandinavia establish two successful outposts along the fjords of Southern Greenland and thrive for more than four hundred years before suddenly and mysteriously disappearing.
programme.desc: Why do civilisations collapse? Follow archaeologists as they examine ruins across the world and uncover the reasons why some of historys greatest civilisations vanished.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: 1323 B.C. / B.C.E.: Egypt is still in chaos left by Akhenatens attempted religious revolution when his son, the young king Tutankhamun, dies; the 18th dynasty comes to an end in a state of disorder.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: Japans escalation of the War in the East is devastatingly effective, but despite their success it is possible to see their inevitable defeat, and they have roused the military might of the USA.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: Vatican Secret Files Exposed: The Pope and the Devil
programme.sub-title: Unpublished documents show that the Vatican tried to fight Hitler; in March 1939, Eugenio Pacelli was elected Pope. What would Pope Pius XII do - openly condemn Nazism, or remain silent... and why?
programme.desc: New and previously published documents identified and analysed by a team of experts show that the plans of Pius XII and and his closest collaborators saved over 700,000 Jews during World War II.

programme.title: Countdown to Surrender
programme.sub-title: January 28th, 1945: the war reaches its climax on German soil. It is the beginning of a hundred days of horror and death, claiming more lives than in all the years of war.
programme.desc: These are the last hundred days of World War ll; we recount crucial milestones in the last days of the Third Reich and its steady decline towards the inevitable capitulation.

programme.title: Deadmans Curse: The Lost Spanish Gold
programme.sub-title: The team follows the failed route of a 1982 news team into the Valley of the Rocks, and Don and Taylor inspect possible Spanish mining artefacts.
programme.desc: A former MMA fighter, an Indigenous explorer, and a mountaineer set out into the wilderness of the Pacific Northwest to solve the 100-year-old mystery of Slumachs lost gold mine.

programme.title: Forbidden History
